revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 16:30:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_ceph.py', 'cinder/backup/drivers/ceph.py'], 'message': 'cinder incremental backup with ceph fails if last one deleted

If the last incremental backup is deleted then the backup snapshot
is deleted but the source volume snapshot remains. Due to mismatch
between the source volume snapshot and backup snapshot, there is an
error when "rbd export-diff" and "rbd import-diff" is done. Hence,
full backup happens.

To fix this issue, all the previous source volume snapshots are
preserved. When the last incremental backup is deleted, then its
backup snapshot is deleted. But because all the source volume snaps
exist, thus it can now update --from-snap for "rbd export-diff" to
be the most recent source volume snapshot for which there exists a
backup snapshot as well. This is how the incremental backup operation
will go successful.

For a user who upgrades to the new code, if the last backup snapshot
and source volume snapshot are in sync, i.e. both of them exist, then
the next create backup operation will continue as an incremental one.
However, if there is no source volume snapshot for the last existing
incremental backup (before the code was upgraded), then a full backup
happens. After this full backup, all the next backups are incremental
while all their corresponding source volume snapshots are also preserved.
In this way, after a user upgrades, if he deletes the last incremental
backup, the next create backup operation will be successful and be
incremental.

Since all the backup snapshots exist for all the backups, if the user
wants to restore a backup, which was created before the code was upgraded,
the user will not lose any data since the same base backup is used.

Change-Id: Ia9c29bb720152d42bec273202fa49ca4b6a41ce2
Closes-Bug: #1703011
(cherry picked from commit bc9ab142da919087c71525978f960115ff0259b9)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
cinder incremental backup with ceph fails if last one deleted

If the last incremental backup is deleted then the backup snapshot
is deleted but the source volume snapshot remains. Due to mismatch
between the source volume snapshot and backup snapshot, there is an
error when "rbd export-diff" and "rbd import-diff" is done. Hence,
full backup happens.

To fix this issue, all the previous source volume snapshots are
preserved. When the last incremental backup is deleted, then its
backup snapshot is deleted. But because all the source volume snaps
exist, thus it can now update --from-snap for "rbd export-diff" to
be the most recent source volume snapshot for which there exists a
backup snapshot as well. This is how the incremental backup operation
will go successful.

For a user who upgrades to the new code, if the last backup snapshot
and source volume snapshot are in sync, i.e. both of them exist, then
the next create backup operation will continue as an incremental one.
However, if there is no source volume snapshot for the last existing
incremental backup (before the code was upgraded), then a full backup
happens. After this full backup, all the next backups are incremental
while all their corresponding source volume snapshots are also preserved.
In this way, after a user upgrades, if he deletes the last incremental
backup, the next create backup operation will be successful and be
incremental.

Since all the backup snapshots exist for all the backups, if the user
wants to restore a backup, which was created before the code was upgraded,
the user will not lose any data since the same base backup is used.

Change-Id: Ia9c29bb720152d42bec273202fa49ca4b6a41ce2
Closes-Bug: #1703011
(cherry picked from commit bc9ab142da919087c71525978f960115ff0259b9)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I074a157e3df18f3ea7ef6a63252b2a2f191133c9

commit_message:
Move to new tempest plugin location

Tempest plugin for aodh has been moved into ceilometer core [1].
Until it's moved outside the ceilometer repo, we should
use this location.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526298/

Change-Id: Id6f8c1ddadb7348bfd169bf82d4b578381ed1506

commit_message:
Add support for VNC TLS

Adds parameters to configure TLS for the nova novnc-proxy to libvirt/qemu
now the support has landed in nova (bp/websocket-proxy-to-host-security).

Change-Id: I24a9841ba04c95df27599b4d7ac2da8416e751e5

commit_message:
Extracted HTTP response codes to constants

There are several places in the source code where HTTP response
codes are used as numeric values.

Status codes 200, 201, 202, 204, 300, 400, 401, 403, 404, 408, 409, 422
and 424 under volume/drivers are replaced with symbolic constants from
six.moves.http_client thus improves code readability.

Closes-Bug: #1520159
Change-Id: I6d0721588af1491139e0dee8d84e21638ec7febb

commit_message:
Extracted HTTP response codes to constants

There are several places in the drivers(dell_emc,hpe) where HTTP
response codes are used as numeric values.

Status codes 200, 400, 401, 403, 404, 409 and 500 under
tests/unit/volume/drivers(dell_emc,hpe) are replaced with symbolic
constants from six.moves.http_client thus improves code readability.
More patches will be submitted to address other status codes.

Partial-Bug: #1520159
Change-Id: I7fd0f1b5a1e15d718e407def2334ff7aea52c071

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 19:54:19.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/quest

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I534f80cd7503971a12712d0b1142bb0badce6fe3
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/quest

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I534f80cd7503971a12712d0b1142bb0badce6fe3

commit_message:
fix the count error of chunked based volume backup

this bug is that the initial value of object_id is 1, and
the last addition was not used.so we change the initial
value of object_id is 0 and add addition before it be used to
make object_name start with object1

Change-Id: I08eecd77998c9b949238cdd9a686eae57d5dd683
Closes-Bug: #1701177

subject: Don't copy ironic's policy.json sample
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 15:37:49.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'message': "Don't copy ironic's policy.json sample

Since ironic change I10a4987204eb335f1fed29d4b1d7f3e075aa1792, the
sample policy.json is not present in the ironic repository. Since policy
is now in code, it is not required.

This change removes support for copying the sample policy file to
/etc/ironic.

Change-Id: Id0e8eb54b0d67ba1c522c6e76afad2b61059a621
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't copy ironic's policy.json sample

Since ironic change I10a4987204eb335f1fed29d4b1d7f3e075aa1792, the
sample policy.json is not present in the ironic repository. Since policy
is now in code, it is not required.

This change removes support for copying the sample policy file to
/etc/ironic.

Change-Id: Id0e8eb54b0d67ba1c522c6e76afad2b61059a621

commit_message:
EDP doc: de-emphasize job binary internals (not in v2)

* Adding deprecation warning about job binary internals in the
  dashboard user guide
* Changing how deprecation warning is given at userdoc edp page
* Changing dashboard user guid job examples, now it uses swift
  as type storage for job binaries instead of internals

Change-Id: Ib1083ee6f6e204248e10f17b5ce58fd424e74106
Partial-Implements: bp remove-job-binary-internal

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-04-07 11:36:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Backup create does not return status

When executing backup create API, output does not
contain any status of backup being created.

But as backup create operation is asynchronous operation,
it must show status as creating etc.

This patchset will fix this issue.

Change-Id: Ied10979a29361471746ba37bea68f8ca16c7269d
Closes-Bug:#1567342
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2016-04-12 10:03:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Backup create does not return status

When executing backup create API, output does not
contain any status of backup being created.

But as backup create operation is asynchronous operation,
it must show status as creating etc.

This patchset will fix this issue.

commit_message:
Backup create does not return status

When executing backup create API, output does not
contain any status of backup being created.

But as backup create operation is asynchronous operation,
it must show status as creating etc.

This patchset will fix this issue.

APIImpact one more response parameter status added

Closes-Bug:#1567342

Change-Id: Ied10979a29361471746ba37bea68f8ca16c7269d

commit_message:
Update accept_transfer to use volume object

The accept_transfer API is now able to use volume versioned objects.

Note that this patch DOES NOT try to use object dot notation everywhere
to keep the size small. This cleanup will be done in the future.

Change-Id: I593f7117101f37db449676235dabdc6494d8bfc3
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

[{'created': '2016-04-20 06:25:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix of finding out available cinder volume services

Currently when creating a volume from source volume or snapshot,
it should check whether there are only one available cinder-volume

services.

Instead it checks whether there are only one disabled cinder-volume

services. This bug is to fix the problem.

Change-Id: I5c2b5926f4c20e024fb3e8d836ffa020ae4b0cf1
Closes-bug: #1572413

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2016-07-04 09:35:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix of finding out available cinder volume services

Currently when creating a volume from source volume or snapshot,
it checks whether backend name of source volume type and target volume
type are same in extra_specs. If same, it allows to create a new volume
from the source volume.

But sometimes there is no backend setting in volume types. The fix is
to allow such case: volume type A has backend setting, there is a volume
in volume type. Volume type B has no backend setting. And users are
going to create a new volume with type B from above volume. In this
scenario, Cinder should allow to create.

In this fix, it checks whether backend of two volume types are same at
first. And then if not same, check whether source.host can be suitable
to target volume type.

Change-Id: I5c2b5926f4c20e024fb3e8d836ffa020ae4b0cf1
Closes-bug: #1572413

commit_message:
Update logic when creating volume from source

Currently when creating a volume from source volume or snapshot,
it checks whether backend name of source volume type and target volume
type are same in extra_specs. If same, it allows to create a new volume
from the source volume.

But sometimes there is no backend setting in volume types. The fix is
to allow such case: volume type A has backend setting, there is a volume
in volume type. Volume type B has no backend setting. And users are
going to create a new volume with type B from above volume. In this
scenario, Cinder should allow to create.

In this fix, it checks whether source.host can be suitable
to target volume type.

Change-Id: I5c2b5926f4c20e024fb3e8d836ffa020ae4b0cf1
Closes-bug: #1572413

commit_message:
Generate support matrix using driver interfaces

Using the ABC classes in cinder.interfaces inspect each driver to
determine what features are implemented and generate a table matrix
using sphinx that users\operators can reference.

Change-Id: If4f7be551e46e7804bf3c99af635c2dd723e5f4f
Co-Authored-By: Karthik Prabhu <karthik.prabhu.vinod@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add snapshots/summary API support

Add a new API to display snapshots summary with total number of snapshots
and total size in GB (total_size: 500 and total_count: 20).

DocImpact
APIImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint display-volumes-summary-details

Change-Id: I39065488fc39c24d47f84d2848993e86e7e3a3aa
Co-Authored-By: MR Swami Reddy <swamireddy@gmail.com>

subject: Zuul: Remove project name
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 14:10:14.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project.yaml'], 'message': 'Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I4c652a85eefa808db7d5e47dcc05ca3bb04388c5

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Add more_info URL to the YAML output

Currently, outputting bandit findings as YAML does not put the
``more_info`` URL in the output as it would if the output format
is HTML or JSON.  This patch set updates the YAML formatter to
include the ``more_info`` URL to be inline with the HTML and JSON
formatters.

Change-Id: Ice134e3bbf67c59feb7a88b299e60838b6ad80d5
Closes-Bug: #1746827

commit_message:
Trim the fat from InstanceInfo

Nova removed several fields from InstanceInfo that were not being
used [1]. This copies our corresponding in-tree driver changes to
the out-of-tree driver.

[1] 5db9389c01b0cb6eeacf57c22550876ffcd1a87c

Closes-Bug: #1695924
Change-Id: I865d9177329294f555dfda14f2ffd85bd022db56

commit_message:
Ironic: negotiate microversion to allow downgrade to Pike

This allows Nova to work with the previous version of Ironic. It
attempts to make a single call to the Ironic API at the current
microversion. If that fails, then it falls back to the previous and
assumes it will work. It also only allows passing a configdrive on
rebuild if the latest microversion is supported.

Partial-Bug: #1739440
Change-Id: Id89e37e939b3ed43fb10bc6b4fa23dcbe172fb8d

commit_message:

commit_message:
Add release-type directives for pike

Some projects have updated their release-type for horizon
plugins in queens, but a similar change has not been done
in pike. Rather than waiting for their first stable release
request to fail, adding these changes to those deliverables
to account for these changes.

Change-Id: Ifd51d3dd1d04b1bb11d311fc46f6faf642d432c4

subject: Switch the LXD compute driver test to non-voting
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 17:01:01.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project.yaml', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Switch the LXD compute driver test to non-voting

LXD 2.0.11 grew a new feature ('description' tag for a container)
and this has been added to the stable Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 release.
Unfortunately, pylxd 2.2.2 can't handle this extra attribute and
crashes out. This was fixed in pylxd 2.2.4, but has not been ported
to the 2.0.x series.

As such, we switch the test job to non-voting until an upstream
fix is available.

Change-Id: Ia4f1351095023cb90d6491f4dbacaf0288f728c1
Related-Source-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python-pylxd/+bug/1736454
Related-Bug: #1746068
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Switch the LXD compute driver test to non-voting

LXD 2.0.11 grew a new feature ('description' tag for a container)
and this has been added to the stable Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 release.
Unfortunately, pylxd 2.2.2 can't handle this extra attribute and
crashes out. This was fixed in pylxd 2.2.4, but has not been ported
to the 2.0.x series.

As such, we switch the test job to non-voting until an upstream
fix is available.

Change-Id: Ia4f1351095023cb90d6491f4dbacaf0288f728c1
Related-Source-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python-pylxd/+bug/1736454
Related-Bug: #1746068

commit_message:
Use repos variable for the upgrade jobs.

In mixed version setup the repos on the undercloud are set to the
target version tested.  During the upgrade to pike for instance the
repo setup command for the undercloud will be empty as the target
version is not “master” but pike.  This can prevent us to get the
latest packages.

Furthermore it simplify the setup as the target repo are configured in
only one place.

Eventually it will make it matches what is configured for the
overcloud in “overcloud-repo.yaml”.

Change-Id: I7f8a3c226e9b28c9569f771233c5331bd808751c

commit_message:
Disable citycloud in nodepool

At the request of Daniel Öhberg, CityNetwork VP of Operations, we
are ceasing booting CI nodes in any remaining regions and pausing
all image uploads for now. We should get back in touch with them
around the beginning of July to find out whether they're ready for
us to reenable use of this account.

Change-Id: I39f12d5a8441b197f5a310c7b33ba42c04c73378

commit_message:
Sort the complete plugin list

Currently the plugin listing found at the link below [1] is unsorted
by bandit ID number, yet the IDs are listed, making it confusing
to look at.

This patch sorts the plugin list by renaming each plugin filename
so that sphinx sorts accordingly.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/bandit/latest/plugins/index.html#complete-test-plugin-listing

Change-Id: Ib16b85d1025dd667f711e8571dd58a59deb74d29

subject: Don't install etcd on a compute-only node
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings'], 'message': "Don't install etcd on a compute-only node

This is associated with current (and not yet fully reliable)
observations that etcd proxy does not work for reading v3 data.  Hence,
instead of using a local proxy, we should configure Calico everywhere to
speak directly to the etcd server.

Change-Id: Ifdb7214de4632a708c9db2f3a23877ea37dbecbc
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't install etcd on a compute-only node

This is associated with current (and not yet fully reliable)
observations that etcd proxy does not work for reading v3 data.  Hence,
instead of using a local proxy, we should configure Calico everywhere to
speak directly to the etcd server.

Change-Id: Ifdb7214de4632a708c9db2f3a23877ea37dbecbc

subject: Capture Felix logging in OpenStack CI runs
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Capture Felix logging in OpenStack CI runs

The OpenStack CI process (devstack-gate) saves off all logs generated by
systemd services that are started with "run_process", but not _all_
services, and so not calico-felix.  But to get the logging from
calico-felix we can use "run_process" to start a secondary service that
just tails Felix's log.  That's what we do here, and the Felix log is
then available in captured logs as a file named
screen-felix-logger.txt.gz.

Change-Id: I40957a3ed4f96a68272a50bcc40303dde770553f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Capture Felix logging in OpenStack CI runs

The OpenStack CI process (devstack-gate) saves off all logs generated by
systemd services that are started with "run_process", but not _all_
services, and so not calico-felix.  But to get the logging from
calico-felix we can use "run_process" to start a secondary service that
just tails Felix's log.  That's what we do here, and the Felix log is
then available in captured logs as a file named
screen-felix-logger.txt.gz.

Change-Id: I40957a3ed4f96a68272a50bcc40303dde770553f

subject: Build WorkloadEndpoint name as libcalico-go requires
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/mech_calico.py'], 'message': "Build WorkloadEndpoint name as libcalico-go requires

libcalico-go needs the name to conform to the pattern
<host>-<orchestrator>-<workload>-<endpoint> (so that it can map to the
v1 WorkloadEndpointKey without reference to the v3 spec).

(Also Felix needs at least some of those pieces to be correct.  I think
probably <host> and <endpoint>, but haven't fully checked.  So we may as
well make them all exactly match the corresponding spec fields.)

Change-Id: Ife4010d0955529364f96ec1941737b0fd255898a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Build WorkloadEndpoint name as libcalico-go requires

libcalico-go needs the name to conform to the pattern
<host>-<orchestrator>-<workload>-<endpoint> (so that it can map to the
v1 WorkloadEndpointKey without reference to the v3 spec).

(Also Felix needs at least some of those pieces to be correct.  I think
probably <host> and <endpoint>, but haven't fully checked.  So we may as
well make them all exactly match the corresponding spec fields.)

Change-Id: Ife4010d0955529364f96ec1941737b0fd255898a

subject: Use monotonic_time() for StatusWatcher inactivity logic
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/t_etcd.py'], 'message': 'Use monotonic_time() for StatusWatcher inactivity logic

I thought time.gmtime() returned a monotonic number of seconds from some
epoch, but in fact it returns a tuple.  monotonic_time() is what we want
here.

Change-Id: Iaaafc0d3b06683829d91d40da3f179b61a9f6d54
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use monotonic_time() for StatusWatcher inactivity logic

I thought time.gmtime() returned a monotonic number of seconds from some
epoch, but in fact it returns a tuple.  monotonic_time() is what we want
here.

Change-Id: Iaaafc0d3b06683829d91d40da3f179b61a9f6d54

commit_message:
Tell Calico how to access the etcd server

Specifically, 127.0.0.1 doesn't work because the devstack-installed etcd
does not listen on that; we need a real IP address.

Change-Id: I0586bf774b59af9ad94e45293506311e4818ef66

commit_message:
Endpoint handling -> v3 as well as v1

Note that we keep the v1 handling as well, for communication with the
DHCP agent, so as to avoid having to update the DHCP agent code as
well (at least for now).

install code is package-based and so gives us etcdv2.

commit_message:
Ironic conductor works correctly on changes of networks

Now ,if provisioning/cleaning network is changed, Ironic conductor
behave correctly. Removed the conductor caching of provisioning/
cleaning network uuid. Now ironic conductor will pick up the
details each and  every time.

commit_message:
mongodb: avoid duplicated resources in systemd config

The unit directory for mongodb service in systemd is already managed by
puppet-systemd. This patch will ensure that puppet-tripleo doesn't
manage the resource anymore and actually rely on it for orchestration
with a "require" statement.

Change-Id: Id030896250117dcc0eb6c4f5a7b8d8aa4d265fa5
Closes-Bug: #1747533
(cherry picked from commit 961a6fd0d4963853d1ee25e6faeed10fbf16f730)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 22:30:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't wait for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

Because we unplug vifs locally, the change may go undetected by the
neutron agent or server, so neutron may not know the vif was unplugged
in the first place and may never send a plug event.

Closes-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-02-02 17:20:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Don't wait for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

Originally, in change Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986 we
added a re-initialization of volumes, encryptors, and vifs to hard
reboot. When creating the libvirt domain and network, we were waiting
for vif plug events from neutron when we replugged the vifs. Then, we
started seeing timeouts in the linuxbridge gate job because compute
was timing out waiting for plug events from neutron during a hard
reboot.

It turns out that the behavior of neutron plug events depends on what
vif type we're using and we're also using a stale network info_cache
throughout the hard reboot code path, so we can't be 100% sure we know
which vifs to wait for plug events from anyway. We coincidentally get
some info_cache refreshes from network-changed events from neutron,
but we shouldn't rely on that.

Ideally, we could do something like wait for an unplug event after we
unplug the vif, then refresh the network_info cache, then wait for the
plug event. BUT, in the case of the os-vif linuxbridge unplug method,
it is a no-op, so I don't think we could expect to get an unplug
event for it (and we don't see any network-vif-unplugged events sent
in the q-svc log for the linuxbridge job during a hard reboot).

Closes-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Don't wait for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

Originally, in change Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986 we
added a re-initialization of volumes, encryptors, and vifs to hard
reboot. When creating the libvirt domain and network, we were waiting
for vif plug events from neutron when we replugged the vifs. Then, we
started seeing timeouts in the linuxbridge gate job because compute
was timing out waiting for plug events from neutron during a hard
reboot.

It turns out that the behavior of neutron plug events depends on what
vif type we're using and we're also using a stale network info_cache
throughout the hard reboot code path, so we can't be 100% sure we know
which vifs to wait for plug events from anyway. We coincidentally get
some info_cache refreshes from network-changed events from neutron,
but we shouldn't rely on that.

Ideally, we could do something like wait for an unplug event after we
unplug the vif, then refresh the network_info cache, then wait for the
plug event. BUT, in the case of the os-vif linuxbridge unplug method,
it is a no-op, so I don't think we could expect to get an unplug
event for it (and we don't see any network-vif-unplugged events sent
in the q-svc log for the linuxbridge job during a hard reboot).

Closes-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 04:57:05.000000000', 'files': ['heat_dashboard/content/template_generator/templates/template_generator/index.html'], 'message': 'i18n: Annotate template generator django template properly

Strings in Django template for the template generator was previously
annotated using angular-gettext syntax, but this is Djnago temaplate.
Djnago templates need to be annotated in the Django i18n way [1].

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/topics/i18n/translation/#internationalization-in-template-code

Partial-Bug: #1747302
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
i18n: Annotate template generator django template properly

Strings in Django template for the template generator was previously
annotated using angular-gettext syntax, but this is Djnago temaplate.
Djnago templates need to be annotated in the Django i18n way [1].

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/topics/i18n/translation/#internationalization-in-template-code

Change-Id: I094fd3ab1c59bb1f96e713a70054cc5b99898974
Partial-Bug: #1747302

commit_message:
Generate HostnameMap with quickstart interface

... and not config-download.yaml.j2 in tripleo-quickstart-extras.
That way, we can get rid of HostnameMap in config-download.yaml.j2
which is only working with one subnode, and we can make it work for any
architecture thanks to the quickstart interface.

Change-Id: I21b151b6bba8f84afff441078b4762453c6a091c

commit_message:
Enable IPv6 scenario tests in Upstream CI

This change complements the work of preceding IPv6 scenario
test changes [1,2] by enabling the settings that allow the tests
to be run in the Upstream CI.

Fix masakari query remote node state

This fix intend to use crm_mon instead of cibadmin for querying
remote node state.

commit_message:
Add nova_notifications flag

This change allows enabling the nova vm state notifications
without the requirement to enable either of ceilometer, designate
or searchlight.

Change-Id: I172c0c0d9ac1c4e42d622b2a80b9fb13e3d4101c

commit_message:

The new ovsdbapp version contains a fix for critical bug 1741889. It
would be great to start testing it before RC cut and include such
version to Q release.

Related-bug: #1741889

commit_message:
Add N1Kv functionality to VM launch

As part of the core-vendor decomposition of horizon, cisco n1kv
specific code in VM launch would be removed from upstream
horizon. This patch adds that functionality back by extending
upstream classes related to VM launch with n1kv code.

It also adds back the unit tests related to launch instance
that will be removed with the main functionality from upstream
horizon.

Change-Id: Iadfc47683364193257cc210de28e7f98dd2e5a2c
Closes-Bug: 1492082

subject: Remove _create_network override code
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-01 23:11:47.000000000', 'files': ['horizon_cisco_ui/cisco/dfa/tabs.py', 'horizon_cisco_ui/overrides.py'], 'message': "Remove _create_network override code

We need to remove following from overrides.py file

horizon_network_workflows.CreateNetwork._create_network = \
    cisco_network_workflows.DFACreateNetwork._create_network

Because of this line it tries to find _create_network function in
workflows.py but it won;t find it because we are using Parent's
_create_network function

Change-Id: I71cf399c82542e69eb5cfacba6642d81ed3ec353
Implements: Fixes Create Network Functionality
Closes-Bug: #1687489
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove _create_network override code

We need to remove following from overrides.py file

horizon_network_workflows.CreateNetwork._create_network = \
    cisco_network_workflows.DFACreateNetwork._create_network

Because of this line it tries to find _create_network function in
workflows.py but it won;t find it because we are using Parent's
_create_network function

Change-Id: I71cf399c82542e69eb5cfacba6642d81ed3ec353
Implements: Fixes Create Network Functionality
Closes-Bug: #1687489

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2017-12-25 09:45:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make workflow execution creation idempotent

* Made workflow execution creation idempotent. We can now
  pass an execution ID which is used when creating a new
  execution object. If the object with this ID doesn't exist,
  then a new execution is created and this ID is assigned to,
  and also the corresponding workflow gets started normally.
  If the object exists then the endpoint just returns
  properties of this object in JSON w/o starting the workflow.
  If an execution ID is not passed then the endpoint works as
  before, so it is backwards compatible with the previous
  version.
* Added unit tests to check all possible logic branches
  depending on whether we passed an execution ID.
* Had to add "wf_ex_id" paramter to the "start_workflow"
  method of the Engine API and fix all relevant calls.
* Other minor changes.

Implements blueprint: mistral-idempotent-execution-create

commit_message:
Make workflow execution creation idempotent

* Made workflow execution creation idempotent. We can now
  pass an execution ID which is used when creating a new
  execution object. If the object with this ID doesn't exist,
  then a new execution is created and this ID is assigned to,
  and also the corresponding workflow gets started normally.
  If the object exists then the endpoint just returns
  properties of this object in JSON w/o starting the workflow.
  If an execution ID is not passed then the endpoint works as
  before, so it is backwards compatible with the previous
  version.
* Added unit tests to check all possible logic branches
  depending on whether we passed an execution ID.
* Had to add "wf_ex_id" paramter to the "start_workflow"
  method of the Engine API and fix all relevant calls.
* Other minor style changes.

Implements blueprint: mistral-idempotent-execution-create

Change-Id: I1f650efbd23b00298a30e16893ca4f18d87c99b3

commit_message:
Remove the unsupported 'insecure_registry' for >=docker 3.0.0

The argument of 'insecure_registry' for image push has been removed
by this commit (in docker 3.0.0):
https://github.com/docker/docker-py/commit/b180b8770a265e33099bd6da76c3e556a1028491

Actually this argument was marked as deprecated and unfunctional
before this removing.

This commit is to remove this parameter at invoking the push() function
when docker version >= 3.0.0.

Change-Id: Ifa7d304d08a4073dcb1dff751d5a443c112cd377
Closes-Bug: #1746703

subject: Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 16:06:50.000000000', 'files': ['babel-django.cfg'], 'message': 'Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

The current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html" does not
match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I7414e9d973be98e5ee6d6277cf750ded40bc6c7a
Closes-Bug: #1747453
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

The current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html" does not
match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I7414e9d973be98e5ee6d6277cf750ded40bc6c7a
Closes-Bug: #1747453

commit_message:
Remove project name from Zuul

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.

commit_message:
Only run map_instances for Ocata

map_instances only needs to be run during the transition from
Newton to Ocata to map existing instances into a cell. All
new Ocata instances will be automatically mapped to a call.
This change limits the slow running map_instances command to
just run for upgrades to Ocata

Change-Id: Ic2e2df530504284d28cfcab26a71d211342203fa
Closes-Bug: #1743357

commit_message:
Remove die-on-term in uwsgi config

This removes setting die-on-term in uwsgi config: it prevents the
services from stopping cleanly instead relying on the SIGKILL after a
timeout.

Change-Id: Ic4a404f5c6e51ae0fd3dd5ef9abfb7ff445d887b
Closes-Bug: #1724497

subject: Improve console install and restart services appropriately
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 10:13:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Improve console install and restart services appropriately

The current implementation wipes out the novnc/spice directory
every single time the playbook executes. While it does replace
it afterwards it does not fire a notifier to make the service
restart, resulting in the service failing.

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

This should ensure that novnc/spice restart properly on upgrades
and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git
SHA or software does not change.

Closes-Bug: #1746523
Change-Id: Ic39f884016a6ba0498110267027783001a087a1c
(cherry picked from commit c41103ba702cd6fd85d8e4d4fe86caef81623f44)

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

commit_message:
Improve console install and restart services appropriately

The current implementation wipes out the novnc/spice directory
every single time the playbook executes. While it does replace
it afterwards it does not fire a notifier to make the service
restart, resulting in the service failing.

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

This should ensure that novnc/spice restart properly on upgrades
and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git
SHA or software does not change.

Backport note:
The 'Manage LB' handler notification is removed as it is not

commit_message:
[placement] Add sending global request ID in put (1)

Add the 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header
in the request of PUT in SchedulerReportClient.
When updating inventories, deleting inventories
(microversion 1.5 not available) and ensuring
a resource class, the header is added.

Subsequent patches will add the header in the other cases.

Change-Id: I02b9f2ef1cbd16d5bf9c4084bc652e94875a6c2a
Partial-Bug: #1734625

commit_message:
partitioner: do not use hash() to determine object identity

The `hash` method is random on Python 3, so it's not consistent between. Just
use the string representation of the object as a default.

Closes-Bug: #1743243
(cherry picked from commit 62fd552e1e1f40e265e3bf781170b21bfb5f4626)

Change-Id: Ic27c0203f629f0260a9ae5758762114488f9b4d0

commit_message:
Correct location of venv build logs

In [1] the intent was to have each venv build log
to its own log file. This makes troubleshooting a
lot easier due to the verbosity of the output in
the log - this at least separates each venv's
output. Unfortunately this extra CLI option was
supposed to be removed. This patch completes the
original intent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/470757

Change-Id: I714d160a39beb870ba66db11a60cf0241ca770f3
(cherry picked from commit 12611a94408421daecdb7daad18ba857cbaba794)

commit_message:
Remove SCREEN_LOGDIR from devstack

SCREEN_LOGDIR has already been deprecated [1]. We should
remove it.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 16:38:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Tempest Neutron test cases for create_port, list_ports and update_port are falied

The test cases are failed for multi node environment because while create a port with "binding:host_id"
for single node host_id can be get with

        cls.host_id = socket.gethostname()

But if compute node is separate then need to get the host_id of the compute where port can be bind.

To get the test case running need host_id to update "binding:host_id"

        cls.host_id = cls.hyper_client.list_hypervisors()['hypervisors'][0]['hypervisor_hostname']

This will work with both single and multi node environment.

Closes-Bug: #1742096

Change-Id: I943150845fa05f24566ea0cd282306136688039b

while running test case over neutron plugin(contrail) with dpdk/sriov
computes, host_id in "binding:host_id" should be compute node name.so
that port can be allocated to a given compute host.

Here we are using "cls.host_id = socket.hostname()" which return
hostname of tempest host.Vrouter will looking for compute node
with tempest hostname to bind port there but didn't found any compute
node with tempest hostname.So raised an exception.

Details: {u'message': u'bad virtual_machine_interface request:
internal error: virtual router default-global-system-config:openstack
not found', u'type': u'badrequest', u'detail': u''}

To get test case running host_id should be compute node name.

Hyper_list = cls.hyper_client.list_hypervisors()
cls.host_id = hyper_list['hypervisors'][0]['hypervisor_hostname']

closes-bug: #1742096

Change-Id: I943150845fa05f24566ea0cd282306136688039b

commit_message:
Neutron test cases create,list,update port failed

while running test case over neutron plugin(contrail) with dpdk/sriov
computes, host_id in "binding:host_id" should be compute node name.so
that port can be allocated to a given compute host.

Here we are using "cls.host_id = socket.hostname()" which return
hostname of tempest host.Vrouter will looking for compute node
with tempest hostname to bind port there but didn't found any compute
node with tempest hostname.So raised an exception.

Details: {u'message': u'bad virtual_machine_interface request:
internal error: virtual router default-global-system-config:openstack
not found', u'type': u'badrequest', u'detail': u''}

To get test case running host_id should be compute node name.

Hyper_list = cls.hyper_client.list_hypervisors()
cls.host_id = hyper_list['hypervisors'][0]['hypervisor_hostname']

closes-bug: #1742096

Change-Id: I943150845fa05f24566ea0cd282306136688039b

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I4f94539240eeeece49b877ea3aabf6dac0421834

commit_message:
INFINIDAT: support deleting datasets with snapshots

Deleting a share or a snapshot from the INFINDIAT InfiniBox should
support a case where the share or snapshot has snapshots that were
created externally (i.e. through the InfiniBox interface).

Change-Id: Ic9d03493283c573506330a620fa21516bbd09c26
Closes-Bug: #1746439

subject: Fix back button on Firefox and Safari
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 10:20:02.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.hacks.js', 'openstack_dashboard/templates/horizon/_scripts.html'], 'message': 'Fix back button on Firefox and Safari

Firefox (and Safari) uses bfcache (back-forward cache)
to load re-visited pages. The solution is to force a reload
when page is loaded from bfcache, so back button will work
correctly.
More information can be found here [1] and here [2].

[1] https://madhatted.com/2013/6/16/you-do-not-understand-browser-history
[2] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8788802/prevent-safari-loading-from-cache-when-back-button-is-clicked

Change-Id: If023bca7c73f983e55c383856e304379c7b8be3a
Closes-bug: #1686315
(cherry picked from commit 7b45b7ae4b175afdfdb512ed87f425cc4f402f51)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix back button on Firefox and Safari

Firefox (and Safari) uses bfcache (back-forward cache)
to load re-visited pages. The solution is to force a reload
when page is loaded from bfcache, so back button will work
correctly.
More information can be found here [1] and here [2].

[1] https://madhatted.com/2013/6/16/you-do-not-understand-browser-history
[2] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8788802/prevent-safari-loading-from-cache-when-back-button-is-clicked

Change-Id: If023bca7c73f983e55c383856e304379c7b8be3a
Closes-bug: #1686315
(cherry picked from commit 7b45b7ae4b175afdfdb512ed87f425cc4f402f51)

Remove bundled intree ceileometer tempest plugin

* All the telemetry related projects intree tempest plugins
  are now moved to telemetry-tempest-plugin
